author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Forest Department has taken up an initiative to plant 68 keystone tree species at the sprawling campus of Arignar Anna Zoological Park in Vandalur.

This exercise is part of a State-wide massive programme in which 68 lakh seedlings will be planted. It was recently inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

Zoo Director K.S.S.V.P. Reddy, officials and staff members planted 25 banyan, 25 peepul and 18 fig saplings on the campus recently.

According to zoo officials, once the trees grow, they will provide canopy for human visitors and offer shelter to birds coming in from various regions. The additional green cover inside the zoo would also help birds and small animals find food, they said.
title: 68 saplings planted in Vandalaur zoo
